docs.snippet: There was a degree of stability last week in the two foreign exchanges which recently had an erratic price movement -- the Canadian free dollar and the Swiss free franc showed improvement, although not by any substantial margin. What appeared...
docs.lead_paragraph: There was a degree of stability last week in the two foreign exchanges which recently had an erratic price movement -- the Canadian free dollar and the Swiss free franc showed improvement, although not by any substantial margin. What appeared significant about the alteration was that there was a cut-back in the offerings, resulting in a firm undertone.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 9 -- President Truman nominated Norman Armour to be Assistant Secretary of State today. If confirmed by the Senate Mr. Armour will fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of Spruille Braden.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 9 -- President Truman nominated Norman Armour to be Assistant Secretary of State today. If confirmed by the Senate Mr. Armour will fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of Spruille Braden.
docs.abstract: Truman names Armour; dept reorganization by Marshall said to be completed

headline.main: ARMOUR IS NAMED AIDE OF MARSHALL; As Assistant Secretary, Career Diplomat Will Succeed Braden, but With Wider Duties ARMOUR IS NAMED AIDE OF MARSHALL NOMINATED BY TRUMAN

docs.snippet: LONDON, June 17 -- Although political uncertainties kept business on the small side in the stock markets here today, a firmer tone was seen in some sections.

docs.snippet: JERUSALEM, June 20 -- After a two-hour private meeting tonight, the United Nations Special Committee on Palestine announced that it would continue touring Palestine until July 3, visiting Arab and Jewish districts. Presumably, the committee will not...
docs.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM, June 20 -- After a two-hour private meeting tonight, the United Nations Special Committee on Palestine announced that it would continue touring Palestine until July 3, visiting Arab and Jewish districts. Presumably, the committee will not begin hearing political testimony until then or later.
docs.abstract: Jewish prisoners in Jerusalem Central Prison conduct strike to be treated as POWs and to protest against conditions

headline.main: U.N. Committee Set to Continue Its Tour or Palestine until July 3; Hearing Delay Until Then Is Seen -- Group, After 3d Private Parley, Silent on Aiding 3 Doomed Terrorists -- Visits Jericho

byline.original: By CLIFTON DANIELSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, June 20 -- The best section in generally cheerful stock markets here today was that devoted to oil shares. Heavy buying based on prospects of world-wide shortage of petroleum products, due to expanding demands coupled with inadequate refining...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, June 20 -- The best section in generally cheerful stock markets here today was that devoted to oil shares. Heavy buying based on prospects of world-wide shortage of petroleum products, due to expanding demands coupled with inadequate refining and storage facilities, plus difficulties of transportation, was the cause.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Oil Section Makes General Advance -- South American Rails Decline
